activity.activitySaved:
Congratulations! The recommendation card will be displayed to your employees under "Offered Activities" during the defined period.

Create more recommendations or invitations where appropriate.
activity.deleteActivity:
The cancellation of a scheduled campaign activity has no consequences for your employees, as long as it has not been published yet.

The cancellation of a scheduled campaign activity after publication results in the fact that the employees no longer see the invitation card under "Offered Activities". If an employee has already accepted the invitation and scheduled the campaign activity event, the activity planning is automatically deleted and a corresponding cancellation message for the calendar appointment is sent to the employee.
activity.editActivity:
The change of a scheduled campaign activity has no consequences for your employees, as long as it has not been published yet.

The change of a scheduled campaign activity after publication leads to un update of the invitation card for the employee under "Offered Activities" accordingly. If an employee has already accepted the invitation and scheduled the campaign activity event, the activity planning is automatically adjusted under "Scheduled Activities" and a corresponding calendar appointment update is sent to the employee.
activity.stateEnter:
Here, you appear as the organizer of this campaign activity. 

All the information that you record on this page, have an impact on the invitation card which is displayed to your employees. In the left column, you see the invitation card as a preview.

With the help of the publication date (from, to) you define when your employees will see this invitation card under "Offered Activities".

campaign.stateEnter:
Concretize your campaign on this page in terms of participants, place and period of the performance. 

Everything you complete on this page, has an impact on the campaign map, which is shown in the left column on this page as a preview. 

After the campaign launch, this campaign map is displayed to the employee. It contains the most important key data for the campaign.

home.campaignAfterFirstWeek:
Check if your employees are actively participating in the campaign. 

Encourage the employees to continue to participate actively in the campaign, e.g. with messages or new offers, and tell the employees how much longer the campaign will last.
home.campaignCreated:
Congratulations on creating a new campaign! 

As a Campaign Manager you can now do the following:

- Click on the edit icon on the campaign map to change key data of your campaign or to add another campaign manager to the campaign.

- Only prior to the campaign launch, enter the email addresses of your employees on this page to invite them to the campaign, or use the invitation link on this page to create your own invitation email.

- Click on "ADD MESSAGES" to record campaign messages. I recommend to send a welcome message at the beginning of the campaign, a motivational message in the course of the campaign and a thank-you message towards the end of the campaign. Ideally, you create the planned messages already before the campaign start and define the publication with the publication date (from-to). 

- Click on "ADD OFFERS" to recommend to the employees a campaign activity to execute "alone" or "in the group", or to invite the employees to a joint campaign activity event. In the latter case, you appear as the organizer. 

I recommend to advise the employees every day a new activity and to organize a campaign activity event once a week. Ideally, you also create the activity recommendations and invitations before the campaign start and define the publication with the publication date (from-to).
home.campaignEnded:
The campaign is over now. Thank you very much for managing this campaign! 

The employees will also be informed about the end of the campaign by me. Nevertheless, I suggest that you, as the campaign manager, inform the employees with a final message about the end of the campaign.

Please tell us under "Feedback" what you liked and what we could do even better. Thank you!

Think about it, if you would like to manage such a campaign with other groups of employees. Of course, you can also plan another campaign concerning another health topic for your employees.
home.campaignFirstWeek:
Check if your employees participate in the campaign and if they are active. 

Call upon the employees again with the campaign link to participate in the campaign or write a message that they should schedule activities.

Also create more offers for campaign activities for the next days. 

To be active together is motivating and fun! Therefore, encourage the employees to invite their colleagues to group activities.
home.campaignLastWeek:
Tell the employees in another message that the campaign draws to a close and encourage them to finish their scheduled activities.

This is also a good moment and a good opportunity, respectively for you to thank the employees for their active participation.
home.campaignStartedToday:
According to your requirements, your web-based health campaign starts today! 

Did you already sent the campaign invitation to all the employees who are going to participate in the campaign? If not, I recommend you do it this very day.

Have you already recorded and published a welcome message, a first recommendation and a first invitation to a campaign activity?

From this day forward, follow daily the progress of your campaign at the top of this page and ask yourself whether the employees log in for the campaign as desired, schedule first activities, etc. 

If the campaign does not run as desired, think about what else you could do (e.g. send another calling / a "friendly reminder" to participate incl. invitation link to the employees, etc.)
home.invitationCreated: Create new recommendations or invitations where appropriate.
home.noCampaigns:
Congratulations. You have entered all the information about your organization. 

Now, you can start creating your first campaign by clicking on "NEW CAMPAIGN". 

I recommend to perform one campaign per operating location. Also consider, if it makes sense to conduct separate campaigns for different groups of employees. 

Also note, that each campaign is linked with a selected topic and a fixed performance period.
home.organizationIncomplete:
Welcome! 

I am your YOUPERS coach. 

I will assist you in creating and managing your HealthCampaigns with tips and hints. 

My first tip for you: Enter additional data about your organization before you begin to create a first campaign.
home.recommendationCreated:
Congratulations! The recommendation card will be displayed to your employees under "Offered Activities" during the defined period.

Create more recommendations or invitations where appropriate.
home.recommendationDeleted:
Your recommendation card was deleted.
Create new recommendations or invitations where appropriate.

ideas.stateEnter:
Have a look at the activity ideas I provided and think about which activity ideas you want to recommend to the employees "to execute alone" or which you want to schedule as the organizer of a campaign activity event. 

Alternatively, you can also create an activity idea yourself that you either recommend to the employees or to which you invite the employees.

Ideally, you as a campaign manager create one activity offer to the employees per day.

organization.missingFields: I would like to point out that the following information is missing to completely capture your organization: {{ fields }}

recommendation.stateEnter: With the help of the publication date (from, to) you define when your employees will see this recommendation card under "Offered Activities".

activity.activitySaved:
Your activity is scheduled now.

I have moved the activity on your main page from "Offered Activities" to "Scheduled Activities".

The activity is now visible on the main page under "Offered Activities" for the invitees ("personally invited" or "all campaign participants"). The personally invited also receive from me a personal invitation in the Inbox or via email.
activity.conflictingEvent: TODO: here goes an appropriate health coach message for a conflicting event
activity.deleteJoinedActivity: The deletion results in the fact that the organizer sees that you have canceled your participation in the group activity.
activity.deleteOwnActivity:
The deletion of an activity "to execute alone" has no other effects, except that the card is moved from the area "Scheduled Activity" to the area "Completed Activity".

The deletion of a group activity results in the fact that the invited employees no longer see your invitation card under "Offered Activities". 

If an employee has already accepted your invitation and scheduled the activity event, the activity planning for the employee will be automatically deleted under "Scheduled Activities" and the employee receives a corresponding calendar appointment cancellation message.
activity.editOwnActivity:
The change of an activity "to execute alone" has no other effects.

The change of a scheduled group activity results in adjusting the activity for the invited employees under "Offered Activities" accordingly. 

If an employee has already accepted the invitation and scheduled the group activity event, the activity planning for the employee will be automatically adjusted under "Scheduled Activities" and a corresponding calendar appointment update is sent to the employee.
activity.eventDone: Congratulations on the completed activity! Keep it up also with the next appointment!
activity.eventMissed: Too bad, can happen to anyone. Make sure you can carry out the next appointment.
activity.eventsDue: Please enter for the expired appointments, if you have carried out the activity or if you missed it. And if you have carried it out, how did you feel doing it.
activity.groupActivityNoEventsDue: Have a look at the comments from the participants of this group activity in the right column of this page and also write a new comment.
activity.invitationAccepted:
Congratulations. You have decided to participate in this group activity.

I have moved the activity on your main page from "Offered Activities" to "Scheduled Activities".

The participants in this group activity can now see on the detail page about this activity that you are also participating in this group activity.

Why not write a comment to the participants of this group activity in the right column; for example, that you look forward to this group activity.
activity.invitationDismissed:
You have decided to dismiss this activity offer. 

Therefore, I have moved the activity on your main page from "Offered Activities" to the area "Dismissed Activities". 

With your decision you give me the chance to show you a new activity recommendation in the area "Offered Activities". Look at it!
activity.lastEventDone:
Congratulations on the completed activity! 

I have moved the activity on your main page from "Scheduled Activities" to "Completed Activities".
activity.lastEventMissed:
Too bad, can happen to anyone.

I have moved the activity on your main page from "Scheduled Activities" to "Completed Activities".
activity.recommendationAccepted:
In the second column, you can now define when, where and how often you want to perform this activity. According to your information the event cards will be displayed in the third column.

For group activities, you can also personally invite other campaign participants in the second column or make the group activity publicly available for all campaign participants. If you want to invite someone personally who is not yet visible as a campaign participant in the selection list, you can also enter an email address as an alternative.

In the right column, enter a comment on the planned activity for the other campaign participants who see your invitation to a group activity. 

Please note that the activity is only scheduled (and will appear on the main page under "Scheduled Activities"), when you click on "save" on the top right.
activity.recommendationDismissed:
You have decided to dismiss this activity offer. 

Therefore, I have moved the activity on your main page from "Offered Activities" to the area "Dismissed Activities". 

With your decision you give me the chance to show you a new activity recommendation in the "Offered Activities". Look at it!
activity.scheduleRecommendedActivity:
Look at the details of the offered activity in the left column and then click on "schedule" if you like the offered activity, or click on "dismiss" if you do not like it.

After you have clicked on "schedule", you can define when, where, how often and with whom at best (only possible for group activities) you want to perform the activity with. In addition, you can leave comments in the right column for group activities that can also be read by other employees and complemented with own comments.
activity.stateEnter: The user is on the schedule page

check.stateEnter:
You can answer as many questions as you want. The more questions you answer, the better the activity recommendations that I show you on the main page under "Offered Activities".

For each question, you can determine for yourself to what extent this point affects your well-being.

As long as you do not complete the self-assessment, you can always come back here and answer more questions.

focus.stateEnter:
Congratulations to the execute self-assessment. That way, you have already made an important first step for yourself by actively giving thoughts to your health situation.

Based on your answers, you can see, where the biggest need for action is. 

To promote your health, I recommend to make some small steps. That is why from now on, you will receive on the main page under "Offered Activities" corresponding activity recommendation cards every day. 

Since you have completed the self-assessment, I will move the self-assessment card on the main page from the area "Scheduled Activities" to the area "Completed Activities".

game.campaignEnded:
Dear User

Thank you for participating in this health campaign! 

Kind regards

Your YOUPERS Coach
game.campaignEndingWithCurrentActivities:
The campaign lasts only a little while.

I recommend, you finish the already scheduled activities and only, if required, schedule new activities.
game.noCurrentActivities:
In the middle at the bottom of this page, new activity recommendation and invitation cards are displayed every day under "Offered Activities" from me, from the campaign manager and from your work colleagues. Schedule some activity!

Click on the map to look at the details about an activity recommendation or invitation and to schedule the activity.

I recommend, out of all the offered activities, you select that activity which suits your personal need for action the best.
game.noOffers:
Welcome!

I am your YOUPERS coach. I support you in your participation in the health campaign with tips and hints. Below my first clues or tips for you: As a first campaign activity, I recommend the accomplishment of a short **self-assessment** (about 10 minutes). The self-assessment allows me to show you possible matching activity cards during the campaign under "Offered Activities". You will get from me from now on a daily activity recommendation card. I have already scheduled for you the self-assessment, which is why the self-assessment card appears above in the middle under "Scheduled Activities". Click on the map to start the self-assessment.
game.noPastOrPresentEventsAndEnoughActivities:
Currently, you have no appointments due today or already expired under "Scheduled Activities".

Before you schedule more offered activities, I suggest you perform the already scheduled activities.
game.noPastOrPresentEventsAndTooFewActivities:
Currently, you have no appointments due today or already expired under "Scheduled Activities".

Maybe you can still find a new recommendation or invitation to an activity under "Offered Activities" that suits you and that you could therefore accept and schedule.
game.pastEvents:
Under "Scheduled Activities", I have marked those activity appointments in terms of color, which are due today.

Perform the activities due today and let me know then, whether you have completed the activities or not, by clicking on the corresponding event card.
game.pastOrPresentEvents:
Under "Scheduled Activities", I have marked those activity appointments in terms of color, which are due today or have already expired.

Perform the activities due today and let me know for expired activities, whether you have carried them out or not, by clicking on the corresponding event card.
